items.sentence: If it's OK with you, I'd like to leave early.
If it rains tomorrow, I won't go on a picnic.
The only thing I want is for you to be happy.
Tom and Mary were in Australia all last year.
Most of the participants come from Australia.
I hope that we can make friends in Australia.
I spoke in French so Tom could understand me.
The meeting shouldn't last more than an hour.
I knew that something like this might happen.
We got a call from Tom about three hours ago.
I'll speak to the section manager about that.
I've always dreamed of becoming an astronaut.
Maybe you don't know me as well as you think.
We didn't do as well as we would've liked to.
Tom did fairly well, but not as well as Mary.
I don't know how to explain how Tom did that.
Tom was sitting in the dark, smoking a cigar.
I think that you know what I'm talking about.
I had no idea you knew how to play the cello.
Is there anyone here who isn't afraid of Tom?
